5.1.6.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
5.1.6.description:
The Adaptive Performance package provides an API to get feedback about the thermal and power state of mobile devices, enabling applications to make performance-relevant adaptions at runtime.

For instruction on how to use samples, please read the documentation.

By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.

samples.description: The base Environment all Adaptive Performance samples use.
Demonstrates how thermal warnings work.
Demonstrates how the bottleneck detection works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Boost works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Cluster Info works.
Demonstrates how Variable Refresh Rate displays can be used with Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance scaler profiles can be used.
Demonstrates how the Automatic Performance Control works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Framrate using target framerate or variable refresh rate works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Batching works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance LOD Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive LUT Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive MSAA works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Resolution works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Shadow Scaler, such as Adaptive Shadow Quality, Adaptive Shadow Resolution, Adaptive Shadow Distance and Adaptive Shadow Cascade work.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Sorting works.
Demonstrates how removing transparent objects works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance View Distance scaler works.
Demonstrates how adding custom Adaptive Performance scaler works by showing how to create Adaptive Fog.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Physics scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance can be used in Visual Scripting.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Decals scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Layer Culling scaler works.
Demonstrates how to control the lifecycle of Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how to listen to performance mode changes.
Demonstrates how game fps automatically reacts to device Game Mode changes.

_upm.changelog:
### Fixed
- Truncate long scaler name to display "..." to be consistent with other editor styles.

5.1.5.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
5.1.5.description:

For instruction on how to use samples, please read the documentation.

By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.

samples.description: The base Environment all Adaptive Performance samples use.
Demonstrates how thermal warnings work.
Demonstrates how the bottleneck detection works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Boost works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Cluster Info works.
Demonstrates how Variable Refresh Rate displays can be used with Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance scaler profiles can be used.
Demonstrates how the Automatic Performance Control works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Framrate using target framerate or variable refresh rate works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Batching works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance LOD Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive LUT Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive MSAA works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Resolution works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Shadow Scaler, such as Adaptive Shadow Quality, Adaptive Shadow Resolution, Adaptive Shadow Distance and Adaptive Shadow Cascade work.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Sorting works.
Demonstrates how removing transparent objects works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance View Distance scaler works.
Demonstrates how adding custom Adaptive Performance scaler works by showing how to create Adaptive Fog.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Physics scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance can be used in Visual Scripting.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Decals scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Layer Culling scaler works.
Demonstrates how to control the lifecycle of Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how to listen to performance mode changes.
Demonstrates how game fps automatically reacts to device Game Mode changes.

_upm.changelog:
### Fixed
- APB-70 Fix temporary memory allocations from the profiler integration causing 6kb each frame in Adaptive Performance Manager.

5.1.1.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
5.1.1.description:
The Adaptive Performance package provides an API to get feedback about the thermal and power state of mobile devices, enabling applications to make performance-relevant adaptions at runtime.

For instruction on how to use samples, please read the documentation.

By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.

samples.description: The base Environment all Adaptive Performance samples use.
Demonstrates how thermal warnings work.
Demonstrates how the bottleneck detection works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Boost works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Cluster Info works.
Demonstrates how Variable Refresh Rate displays can be used with Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance scaler profiles can be used.
Demonstrates how the Automatic Performance Control works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Framrate using target framerate or variable refresh rate works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Batching works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance LOD Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive LUT Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive MSAA works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Resolution works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Shadow Scaler, such as Adaptive Shadow Quality, Adaptive Shadow Resolution, Adaptive Shadow Distance and Adaptive Shadow Cascade work.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Sorting works.
Demonstrates how removing transparent objects works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance View Distance scaler works.
Demonstrates how adding custom Adaptive Performance scaler works by showing how to create Adaptive Fog.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Physics scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance can be used in Visual Scripting.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Decals scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Layer Culling scaler works.
Demonstrates how to control the lifecycle of Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how to listen to performance mode changes.
Demonstrates how game fps automatically reacts to device Game Mode changes.

_upm.changelog:
### Fixed
- APB-45 Custom Adaptive Performance Scaler is not updated in the Profiler and Simulator when it does not have an overridden name
- Issues with Scaler profiles not applied during start initialization
- APB-34 Adaptive Performance reset Application.target framerate to -1
- APB-36: "NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object“ error is thrown when clicking on the disabled Default Scaler Profile setting
- APB-40 In ShadowQuality Scaler the MainLightShadowCascadesCountBias being incorrectly adjusted when changing Adaptive Performance Shadow Quality. It adjust ShadowQualityBias now instead.
- DOCR-4448, DOCR-4715, DOCR-4608 - Documentation fixes.

samples.description: The base Environment all Adaptive Performance samples use.

Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance scaler profiles can be used.

Demonstrates how Adaptive Framrate using target framerate or variable refresh rate works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Batching works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance LOD Scaler works.

### Added
* New property on `IAdaptivePerformanceSettings` to enable automated frame rate control based on the device performance mode changes.

5.0.0.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
5.0.0.description:
The Adaptive Performance package provides an API to get feedback about the thermal and power state of mobile devices, enabling applications to make performance-relevant adaptions at runtime.

For instruction on how to use samples, please read the documentation.

By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.

samples.description: The base Environment all Adaptive Performance samples use.
Demonstrates how thermal warnings work.
Demonstrates how the bottleneck detection works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Boost works.
Demonstrates how the Adaptive Performance Cluster Info works.
Demonstrates how Variable Refresh Rate displays can be used with Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance scaler profiles can be used.
Demonstrates how the Automatic Performance Control works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Framrate using target framerate or variable refresh rate works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Batching works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance LOD Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive LUT Scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive MSAA works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Resolution works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Shadow Scaler, such as Adaptive Shadow Quality, Adaptive Shadow Resolution, Adaptive Shadow Distance and Adaptive Shadow Cascade work.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Sorting works.
Demonstrates how removing transparent objects works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance View Distance scaler works.
Demonstrates how adding custom Adaptive Performance scaler works by showing how to create Adaptive Fog.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Physics scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance can be used in Visual Scripting.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Decals scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Layer Culling scaler works.
Demonstrates how to control the lifecycle of Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how to listen to performance mode changes.

_upm.changelog:
### Added
* New APIs for controlling the lifecycle of Adaptive Performance.
* New `IPerformanceModeStatus` for retrieving performance mode and listening to performance mode changes.
* Support for new the [Android](https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.adaptiveperformance.google.android@latest/index.html) Adaptive Performance provider.
* New property on `IAdaptivePerformance` to access the active subsystem.

### Removed
* Dependency on com.unity.subsystemregistration

### Changed
* Adaptive Performance Subsystem is using the internal Subsystems module now and removed the subsystem registration. This introduces an internal APProvider class.
* Adjusted labeling of new Android provider to be listed as Android provider.
* Adjusted Project Settings to not allow displaying options that are not present on all Providers.

### Fixed
- Adjusted the loader and subsystem initialization process to allow for falling back to another subsystem if init is not successful.
- Addressed silent test failure reporting as success now surfacing as a failure after UTF bug addressed.

5.0.0-pre.4.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance

_upm.changelog:
### Added
* New APIs for controlling the lifecycle of Adaptive Performance.
* New `IPerformanceModeStatus` for retrieving performance mode and listening to performance mode changes.
* Support for new the [Android](https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.adaptiveperformance.google.android@latest/index.html) Adaptive Performance provider.
* New property on `IAdaptivePerformance` to access the active subsystem.

### Removed
* Dependency on com.unity.subsystemregistration

### Changed
* Adaptive Performance Subsystem is using the internal Subsystems module now and removed the subsystem registration. This introduces an internal APProvider class.
* Adjusted labeling of new Android provider to be listed as Android provider.

### Fixed
- Adjusted the loader and subsystem initialization process to allow for falling back to another subsystem if init is not successful.
- Addressed silent test failure reporting as success now surfacing as a failure after UTF bug addressed.

Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance View Distance scaler works.
Demonstrates how adding custom Adaptive Performance scaler works by showing how to create Adaptive Fog.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Physics scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance can be used in Visual Scripting.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Decals scaler works.
Demonstrates how Adaptive Performance Layer Culling scaler works.
Demonstrates how to control the lifecycle of Adaptive Performance.
Demonstrates how to listen to performance mode changes.

1.2.3.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
1.2.3.description:
The Adaptive Performance package provides an API to get feedback about the thermal and power state of mobile devices, enabling applications to make performance-relevant adaptions at runtime.

 This package is installed as a dependency by Adaptive Performance subsystem packages such as the Adaptive Performance Samsung (Android) package. By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.

1.1.0-preview.7.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
1.1.0-preview.7.description:
The Adaptive Performance package provides an API to get feedback about the thermal and power state of mobile devices, enabling applications to make performance-relevant adaptions at runtime.

 This package is installed as a dependency by Adaptive Performance subsystem packages such as the Adaptive Performance Samsung (Android) package. By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.

0.2.0-preview.1.name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
0.2.0-preview.1.description:
The Adaptive Performance package provides an API to get feedback about the thermal and power state of mobile devices and thus enables applications to make performance relevante adaptions at runtime.

 This package is installed as dependency by Adaptive Performance subsystem packages such as the *Adaptive Performance Samsung (Android)* package. By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.

name: com.unity.adaptiveperformance
description:
The Adaptive Performance package provides an API to get feedback about the thermal and power state of mobile devices, enabling applications to make performance-relevant adaptions at runtime.

For instruction on how to use samples, please read the documentation.

By installing this package, you agree to the terms and conditions of the Unity End User License Agreement found under "View licenses" above.
